snippet: Criminal charges in Florida against George Zimmerman, who shot and killed Trayvon Martin, were a step forward. The case should also put the state’s self-defense law on trial.
abstract: Editorial welcomes special prosecutor Angela Corey's decision to bring second-degree murder charges against George Zimmerman, the Florida man who shot and killed Trayvon Martin; contends that the trial should scrutinize how the Stand Your Ground law invites gun owners to flirt with vigilantism.
lead_paragraph: Criminal charges in Florida against George Zimmerman, who shot and killed Trayvon Martin, were a step forward. The case should also put the state’s self-defense law on trial.

headline.seo: Searching for Justice in the Trayvon Martin Case
